intro: Cryptospora inconspicua, commonly known as the ghost moss, is a rare and elusive moss species belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, slender shoots and small, pale green to reddish-brown leaves that are often difficult to spot in its natural habitat. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as rocky crevices or forest floors, where it thrives in cool, humid conditions. Its reproductive structures, including capsules, are borne on short, lateral branches, contributing to its inconspicuous appearance. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, Cryptospora inconspicua is of interest to botanists studying cryptogamic diversity and conservation.
